spanGrp.span: a fallen leaf and a lump of mud
They loved each other very much.
chọọnṭang tuwng dọnu̠ "Kahloǃ Khu ra nite, nang kāden pangnu̠
The lump of mud said" If it rains, cover meǃ"
aṭhọ hrāng nite, ni ānang pang ningsung"
And if a wind blows, I will press you down."
atatuwng unsah ilosinsung hlo athuw chaka no dọjenu̠
So, they will love each other, and said "Let's be best friends"
soolhna tuwng chọọntang to den pangnu̠
the fallen leaf covered the lump of mud.
chọọnṭang tuwng soolhna to den pangnu̠
the lump of mud covered the fallen leaf.
Atapang tuwng khu ra nite, aṭhọ hrāng nite
Similarly when it rained, when the wind blew
aṭhing jenu̠, inang pang jenu̠, peekhum pang jenu̠
They helped each other, covered one another.
the lump of mud was covered by the leaf.
The lump of mud was safe.
Soolhna tuwng chọọnṭang to den pangnu̠
The leaf covered the lump of mud.
It did not melt, and similarly
chọọnṭang tuwng soolhna to nang khu̠nu̠
the lump of mud covered the leaf again.
The wind did not blow it away.
And like that it happened on and on.
nikheh te aṭhọ kheh hrāngnu̠, khu-kheh vahrāng- khu-kheh ranu̠
One day, there was a wind blowing and it was raining.
Soolhna tokheh isoo pah ha hrān dohnu̠
The leaf was blown very far away.
And it rained a lot on the lump of mud.
unsah tangna aṭhin jenu̠ dọnu̠ tuboo
with lots of pity they were separated.
